body_content.explanation:
abbreviation for 
temporomandibular joint : one of the joints in the body on each side of the head that connect the mandible (= the bone that forms the shape of the lower part of the face) to the temporal bones, which are at the sides of the skull (= the bones of the head that surround the brain and give the upper part of the head its shape):
examples: She sustained an injury to her TMJ in a car accident.
He sees some patients whose headaches are caused by a TMJ disorder.

body_content.explanation:
abbreviation for 
temporomandibular joint disorder : a problem affecting one or both of the joints between the temporal bones (= the bones at the sides of the head at the base of the skull) and the mandible (= the lower jaw):
examples: For many people, stress is the cause of TMJ.
Little was known about TMJ at that time, but she said she was fortunate enough to find a good oral surgeon.
